roleset.name: provide with cash value
roleset.note: CAPITALIZE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'capitalize' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No verbnet entry. Comparison to 'take' and 'value'. (from capitalize.01-v predicate notes)
CAPITALIZATION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. (from capitalization.01-n)

example.name: passivized
example.text: Some think [Columbia's thrift, which now is seeking a new chief operating officer]-1, might be capitalized *trace* at, say $300 million, and shopped to a commercial bank that wants a California presence.

example.name: active, no value
example.text: [You]*-1 sell the good bank as an ongoing operation and use some of the proceeds [*-1]to capitalize the bad bank,'' says thrift specialist Lewis Ranieri of Ranieri Associates in New York.

example.name: Arg1
example.text: If the share price is 25.5 p per share , there are 68.37 million shares in issue and acording to ADVN the total market capitlisation is approx 17 million .

roleset.name: take advantage of
roleset.note: CAPITALIZE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'capitalize' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No verbnet entry. Comparison to 'take' and 'value'. (from capitalize.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: take advantage of
example.text: Sales climbed 71% to $6.36 billion from $3.72 billion as the company capitalized on the ravenous global demand for commercial airliners.
example.arg: on the ravenous global demand for commercial airliners
